str2: Then, therefore, since. Probably from airo; a particle denoting an inference more or less decisive.
And, even, also, namely.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Or heneken hen'-ek-en or heineken hi'-nek-en; of uncertain affinity; on account of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To act unjustly towards, injure, harm. From adikos; to be unjust, i.e. do wrong.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To act unjustly towards, injure, harm. From adikos; to be unjust, i.e. do wrong.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
Or heneken hen'-ek-en or heineken hi'-nek-en; of uncertain affinity; on account of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
(a) speed, haste, (b) diligence, earnestness, enthusiasm. From speudo; 'speed', i.e. despatch, eagerness, earnestness.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.
To make clear (visible, manifest), make known. From phaneros; to render apparent.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
